userreviews.userReview: This is just such a fun cozy series, and it's always hard to see whodunit! The Juniper Grove setting is like another character, since it adds extra flavor to the mysteries. Endearing characters--I like Miss Julia!

If you like cozy mysteries, here is a good one. It's book two in Karin Kaufman's 'Juniper Grove Mystery' series. I loved the first and I loved this one. There are five total! I can't wait for the next one.These books are best read in order. Mystery writer Rachel Stowe moves back to her native Colorado after a disappointment in the big city of Boston. Now, she's solving real-life mysteries, along with her two new friends and cohorts in sleuthing. Now, if she can only get this police chief to look her way! Clever and well written, Kaufman's mysteries keep you guessing until the end. And if you want a tighter mystery and loads of suspense, try her Anna Denning Mystery series. It's wonderful!*I was given a complimentary copy of this book. All opinions are my own and honest.

Halloween and murder is taking over the charming town of Juniper Grove, Colorado.This second book, in the series, kept me guessing and I loved the "team" - Rachel, Holly and Julia - swinging into action. The mystery was fast-paced and I changed my mind about the murderer several times! I loved the idea of using a scavenger hunt as a setting for murder, especially during Halloween. Not only did I enjoy the mystery, but also the descriptions of the town in October. The setting was rich, cozy and made me long for hot chocolate, cinnamon tea, sweaters, and of course, almond scones and cream puffs from Hollys's Sweets!I can't wait for my next visit to Juniper Grove!

In Death of a Scavenger by Karin Kaufmsan, Rachel Stowe and her friend Holly, baker of the best cream puffs in Colorado, are taking part in Juniper Grove’s annual October Scavenger Hunt when they see the participants all racing in one direction. Following everyone, the pair sees a crowd surrounding the stabbed body of Maureen Nicholson, possibly the meanest woman in Juniper Grove. When Police Chief Gilroy examines everyone’s pockets and bags, he finds a bloody flash drive in the pocket of Holly’s bag. The next day Holly finds that a boy has spray painted the word “Murderer” on the window of her bakery. When Rachel learns that the children are bullying Holly’s son because they see his mother as a murderer, something they learned from their parents, Rachel determines to solve the crime to clear Holly’s name.Read the rest of this review and other fun, geeky articles at Fangirl Nation

Even better!I have to be honest, I wasn’t sold on the Juniper Grove series after I finished the first book but, less than halfway into book two, SOLD! The characters’ personalities are coming out more and the towns dynamic is really evolving. I appreciate Ms. Kaufman’s choice to write a series that is “clean.” She proves that you don’t have to put sex, violence, and foul language in a book in order for it to be a truly enjoyable book. Now it’s time to dive into book number 3!

Loved it This author is excellent. I enjoy reading her books. She writes about a mystery writer who tries to solve mysteries in her new little town. In Death of a Scavenger, Holly is accused of murder. Rachel Stowe is out to prove her friend innocent. Rachel uses her skills as a mystery writer to help solve the crime! Is there romance blooming in Juniper Grove?

I really enjoy the main character n this book. Her close friends are well developed as well. The people in this book's mystery were so petty and immature, I lost interest in who actually committed the crime.
Loved it!Thoroughly enjoyable cozy.A scavenger hunt turns deadly and Rachel feels obligated to investigate when fingers are pointed at Holly.
Death of a ScavengerVery good cozy mystery. It has realistic complex characters, good people and not so good people. It also doesn't gratuitously give away the ending.
The characters have really come together in this second book of the series. I will definitely be reading the next one.
Enjoyable cozyVery enjoyable cozy. Good character buildup and follow through. Looking forward to next book in the series. A thumbs up.
Good book.Good book with an interesting storyline. I will read.more of this author's books. The characters are interesting as the story progresses you feel like you know them.
My reviewGood book, I enjoyed reading it. Juniper Grove is indeed a great place to spend time. Keep up the good work.
Enjoyed it just as much as the first in the series. I especially liked the seasonal element of the book's being set in the fall.
BullyThis was a well written story. The characters were like people you meet in real life. The ending was a surprise.

Juniper Grove, Colorado, is a small town, but newcomer Rachel Stowe is about to find her second dead body, only a month after the first one turned up in her back yard.At least this one’s on someone else’s property.In the middle of the town’s annual Halloween scavenger hunt (complete with fake corpse) a second, real corpse is found – and it’s hard to find anyone other than Rachel who doesn’t have a motive.Again, Rachel and her friends Julia and Holly team up to solve the mystery. It’s not that Rachel thinks Police Chief Gilroy is incompetent. Far from it. She’s just afraid he’s looking in the wrong places.Death of a Scavenger is book two in the Juniper Grove mystery series, and it’s good to spend more time with these characters… and to vicariously enjoy the cream puffs from Holly’s bakery.My favourite addition to the cast of characters is Gina, a grey-dreadlocked lady with mobility issues who lives in a brightly-painted house.Clues and diversions abound, along with more conflict with the ever-patient Chief Gilroy, and again Rachel plays a key part in solving the mystery.The Juniper Grove novels are short, quick reads. They’re clean and not too intense – perfect for those times when you don’t want anything too heavy. That said, the characters always leave you with something to think about, even if it’s just the challenge to be kinder to someone who’s marginalized like Gina.Karin Kaufman is also the author of the Anna Denning mystery series. Death of a Scavenger is the second in the Juniper Grove mystery series. For more about the author and her books, visit karinkaufman.com.[Review copy from my personal library.]

description: More than a few people in Juniper Grove want Maureen Nicholson dead, so when her body turns up during Juniper Grove’s annual October scavenger hunt, there’s no shortage of suspects or motives. But when suspicion for the murder falls on Rachel Stowe’s friend Holly, baker extraordinaire, Rachel must get to the bottom of the mystery.Convinced there’s no romance in her future with the town’s police chief, Rachel dives headlong into the case, ignoring his disapproval and risking her own safety. But will she uncover the truth before the killer claims another victim?Juniper Grove Mystery Series:Book 1: Death of a Dead ManBook 2: Death of a Scavenger
title:
Death of a Scavenger
      
          (Juniper Grove #2)
